entry.title: Installing Cuckoo Sandbox on macOS
entry.content:
We will cover only installing Cuckoos and not the configurating process since this is really the most difficult hurdle we have seen for new analyst. Please use Cuckoos Project for configuration recommendations.

On a new macOS system there are a couple things we need to gather before installing, we will call this pre-install. For install we will need multiple packages, we will call this install

Pre-install collection

  • pip
  • virtualenv

Install

  • many packages, list to follow...

Install pip

$ sudo easy_install pip

Install virtualenv & activate:

$ cd cuckoo_sanbox/
$ virtualenv venv
virtualenv venv
created virtual environment…
…
  activators PythonActivator… 


$ source ./venv/bin/activate
$ cd venv
(venv)$ pip install -U pip setuptools

So, when you try to install Cuckoos from pip, as seen below, you will get an error on capstone and unicorn packages:


(venv)$ pip install -U cuckoo
PYTHONWARNINGS=ignore:DEPRECATION pip install cuckoo
    Processing
    …
Collecting django==1.8.4
  Using cached Django-1.8.4-py2.py3-none-any.whl (6.2 MB)
…
Building wheels for collected packages: unicorn, capstone
  Building wheel for unicorn (setup.py) ... error
  ERROR: Command errored out with exit status 1:
…
Running setup.py clean for unicorn
  Building wheel for capstone (setup.py) ... error
…
Running setup.py clean for capstone
Failed to build unicorn capstone
…
command output.

The fix

We will need to download Cuckoos, edit capstone package, and modify Cuckoo criteria list of the package

adding fix...

Download cuckoo, since it will fail on venv pip install:

(venv)$ pip download cuckoo
Collecting cuckoo
  Using cached Cuckoo-2.0.7.tar.gz (8.6 MB)
  Saved ./Cuckoo-2.0.7.tar.gz
Collecting alembic==1.0.10
  Using cached alembic-1.0.10.tar.gz (1.0 MB)
  Saved ./alembic-1.0.10.tar.gz 
…
Collecting scandir; python_version < "3.5"
  Using cached scandir-1.10.0.tar.gz (33 kB)
  Saved ./scandir-1.10.0.tar.gz
Successfully downloaded cuckoo…
Take a look at packages:

ls | xargs -n 1 | grep 'Cuck\|cap\|uni'
Cuckoo-2.0.7.tar.gz
capstone-3.0.5rc2.tar.gz
unicorn-1.0.1.tar.gz

Perfection
entry.summary: We will cover only installing Cuckoos and not the configurating process since this is really the most difficult hurdle we have seen for new analyst. Please use Cuckoos Project for configuration recommendations.
